definitions.definition: In Euclidean spaces: a set of points obtained by adding a given fixed vector to each point of a given set.
Senses relating to the change of information, etc., from one form to another.
Senses relating to a change of position.
To entrance, to cause to lose recollection or sense.
definitions.example: William was translated by the blow to the head he received, being unable to speak for the next few minutes.
